private_key_passphrase.description: Supports the encryption ciphers aes-128-cbc, aes-128-gcm, aes-192-cbc, aes-192-gcm, aes-256-cbc, aes-256-gcm, and des-ede3-cbc

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the account.

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

api_allowed_prefixes.description: Explicitly limits external functions that use the integration to reference one or more HTTPS proxy service endpoints and resources within those proxies.

api_aws_external_id.description: The external ID that Snowflake will use when assuming the AWS role.

api_aws_iam_user_arn.description: The Snowflake user that will attempt to assume the AWS role.

api_aws_role_arn.description: ARN of a cloud platform role.

api_blocked_prefixes.description: Lists the endpoints and resources in the HTTPS proxy service that are not allowed to be called from Snowflake.

api_provider.description: Specifies the HTTPS proxy service type.

azure_ad_application_id.description: The 'Application (client) id' of the Azure AD app for your remote service.

azure_tenant_id.description: Specifies the ID for your Office 365 tenant that all Azure API Management instances belong to.

created_on.description: Date and time when the API integration was created.

enabled.description: Specifies whether this API integration is enabled or disabled. If the API integration is disabled, any external function that relies on it will not work.

name.description: Specifies the name of the API integration. This name follows the rules for Object Identifiers. The name should be unique among api integrations in your account.

from_database.description: Specify a database to create a clone from.

from_share.description: Specify a provider and a share in this map to create a database from a share.

database_name.description: The name of the database on which to grant privileges.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the database.

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

api_integration.description: The name of the API integration object that should be used to authenticate the call to the proxy service.

comment.description: A description of the external function.

compression.description: If specified, the JSON payload is compressed when sent from Snowflake to the proxy service, and when sent back from the proxy service to Snowflake.

context_headers.description: Binds Snowflake context function results to HTTP headers.

created_on.description: Date and time when the external function was created.

database.description: The database in which to create the external function.

max_batch_rows.description: This specifies the maximum number of rows in each batch sent to the proxy service.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the external function. The identifier can contain the schema name and database name, as well as the function name. The function's signature (name and argument data types) must be unique within the schema.

null_input_behavior.description: Specifies the behavior of the external function when called with null inputs.

return_behavior.description: Specifies the behavior of the function when returning results

return_null_allowed.description: Indicates whether the function can return NULL values or must return only NON-NULL values.

return_type.description: Specifies the data type returned by the external function.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the external function.

url_of_proxy_and_resource.description: This is the invocation URL of the proxy service and resource through which Snowflake calls the remote service.

name.description: Argument name

block.description: Specifies the arguments/inputs for the external function. These should correspond to the arguments that the remote service expects.

name.description: Header name

block.description: Allows users to specify key-value metadata that is sent with every request as HTTP headers.

auto_refresh.description: Specifies whether to automatically refresh the external table metadata once, immediately after the external table is created.

aws_sns_topic.description: Specifies the aws sns topic for the external table.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the external table.

copy_grants.description: Specifies to retain the access permissions from the original table when an external table is recreated using the CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE variant

database.description: The database in which to create the external table.

file_format.description: Specifies the file format for the external table.

location.description: Specifies a location for the external table.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the external table; must be unique for the database and schema in which the externalTable is created.

owner.description: Name of the role that owns the external table.

partition_by.description: Specifies any partition columns to evaluate for the external table.

pattern.description: Specifies the file names and/or paths on the external stage to match.

refresh_on_create.description: Specifies weather to refresh when an external table is created.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the external table.

as.description: String that specifies the expression for the column. When queried, the column returns results derived from this expression.

name.description: Column name

block.description: Definitions of a column to create in the external table. Minimum one required.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future external tables on which to grant privileges.

external_table_name.description: The name of the external table on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is false).

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future external tables in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future external tables in the given database. The external_table_name and shares fields must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future external table.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future external tables on which to grant privileges.

shares.description: Grants privilege to these shares (only valid if on_future is false).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

allow_duplicate.description: Boolean that specifies to allow duplicate object field names (only the last one will be preserved).

binary_as_text.description: Boolean that specifies whether to interpret columns with no defined logical data type as UTF-8 text.

binary_format.description: Defines the encoding format for binary input or output.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the file format.

compression.description: Specifies the current compression algorithm for the data file.

database.description: The database in which to create the file format.

date_format.description: Defines the format of date values in the data files (data loading) or table (data unloading).

disable_auto_convert.description: Boolean that specifies whether the XML parser disables automatic conversion of numeric and Boolean values from text to native representation.

disable_snowflake_data.description: Boolean that specifies whether the XML parser disables recognition of Snowflake semi-structured data tags.

empty_field_as_null.description: Specifies whether to insert SQL NULL for empty fields in an input file, which are represented by two successive delimiters.

enable_octal.description: Boolean that enables parsing of octal numbers.

encoding.description: String (constant) that specifies the character set of the source data when loading data into a table.

error_on_column_count_mismatch.description: Boolean that specifies whether to generate a parsing error if the number of delimited columns (i.e. fields) in an input file does not match the number of columns in the corresponding table.

escape.description: Single character string used as the escape character for field values.

escape_unenclosed_field.description: Single character string used as the escape character for unenclosed field values only.

field_delimiter.description: Specifies one or more singlebyte or multibyte characters that separate fields in an input file (data loading) or unloaded file (data unloading).

file_extension.description: Specifies the extension for files unloaded to a stage.

format_type.description: Specifies the format of the input files (for data loading) or output files (for data unloading).

ignore_utf8_errors.description: Boolean that specifies whether UTF-8 encoding errors produce error conditions.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the file format; must be unique for the database and schema in which the file format is created.

null_if.description: String used to convert to and from SQL NULL.

preserve_space.description: Boolean that specifies whether the XML parser preserves leading and trailing spaces in element content.

record_delimiter.description: Specifies one or more singlebyte or multibyte characters that separate records in an input file (data loading) or unloaded file (data unloading).

replace_invalid_characters.description: Boolean that specifies whether to replace invalid UTF-8 characters with the Unicode replacement character (�).

schema.description: The schema in which to create the file format.

skip_blank_lines.description: Boolean that specifies to skip any blank lines encountered in the data files.

skip_byte_order_mark.description: Boolean that specifies whether to skip the BOM (byte order mark), if present in a data file.

skip_header.description: Number of lines at the start of the file to skip.

strip_null_values.description: Boolean that instructs the JSON parser to remove object fields or array elements containing null values.

strip_outer_array.description: Boolean that instructs the JSON parser to remove outer brackets.

strip_outer_element.description: Boolean that specifies whether the XML parser strips out the outer XML element, exposing 2nd level elements as separate documents.

time_format.description: Defines the format of time values in the data files (data loading) or table (data unloading).

timestamp_format.description: Defines the format of timestamp values in the data files (data loading) or table (data unloading).

trim_space.description: Boolean that specifies whether to remove white space from fields.

validate_utf8.description: Boolean that specifies whether to validate UTF-8 character encoding in string column data.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future file formats on which to grant privileges.

file_format_name.description: The name of the file format on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is false).

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future file formats in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future file formats in the given database. The file_format_name field must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future file format.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future file formats on which to grant privileges.

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the function.

database.description: The database in which to create the function. Don't use the | character.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the function; does not have to be unique for the schema in which the function is created. Don't use the | character.

null_input_behavior.description: Specifies the behavior of the function when called with null inputs.

return_behavior.description: Specifies the behavior of the function when returning results

return_type.description: The return type of the function

schema.description: The schema in which to create the function. Don't use the | character.

statement.description: Specifies the javascript / java / sql code used to create the function.

name.description: The argument name

block.description: List of the arguments for the function

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future functions on which to grant privileges.

function_name.description: The name of the function on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is false).

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future functions in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future functions in the given database. The function_name, arguments, return_type, and shares fields must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future function.

return_type.description: The return type of the function (must be present if function_name is present)

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future functions on which to grant privileges.

shares.description: Grants privilege to these shares (only valid if on_future is false).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

name.description: The argument name

block.description: List of the arguments for the function (must be present if function has arguments and function_name is present)

integration_name.description: Identifier for the integration; must be unique for your account.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the integration.

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

admin_name.description: Identifier, as well as login name, for the initial user in the managed account. This user serves as the account administrator for the account.

admin_password.description: Password for the initial user in the managed account.

cloud.description: Cloud in which the managed account is located.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the managed account.

created_on.description: Date and time when the managed account was created.

locator.description: Display name of the managed account.

name.description: Identifier for the managed account; must be unique for your account.

region.description: Snowflake Region in which the managed account is located.

type.description: Specifies the type of managed account.

url.description: URL for accessing the managed account, particularly through the web interface.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the masking policy.

database.description: The database in which to create the masking policy.

masking_expression.description: Specifies the SQL expression that transforms the data.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the masking policy; must be unique for the database and schema in which the masking policy is created.

return_data_type.description: Specifies the data type to return.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the masking policy.

value_data_type.description: Specifies the data type to mask.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the masking policy on which to grant privileges.

masking_policy_name.description: The name of the masking policy on which to grant privileges immediately.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the masking policy.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the masking policy on which to grant privileges.

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the view.

database.description: The database in which to create the view. Don't use the | character.

is_secure.description: Specifies that the view is secure.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the view; must be unique for the schema in which the view is created.

or_replace.description: Overwrites the View if it exists.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the view. Don't use the | character.

statement.description: Specifies the query used to create the view.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future materialized views on which to grant privileges.

materialized_view_name.description: The name of the materialized view on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is false).

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future materialized views in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future materialized views in the given database. The materialized_view_name and shares fields must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future materialized view view.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future materialized views on which to grant privileges.

shares.description: Grants privilege to these shares (only valid if on_future is false).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

allowed_ip_list.description: Specifies one or more IPv4 addresses (CIDR notation) that are allowed access to your Snowflake account

blocked_ip_list.description:
Specifies one or more IPv4 addresses (CIDR notation) that are denied access to your Snowflake account

**Do not** add `0.0.0.0/0` to `blocked_ip_list`

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the network policy.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the network policy; must be unique for the account in which the network policy is created.

network_policy_name.description: Specifies the identifier for the network policy; must be unique for the account in which the network policy is created.

set_for_account.description:
Specifies whether the network policy should be applied globally to your Snowflake account

**Note:** The Snowflake user running `terraform apply` must be on an IP address allowed by the network policy to set that policy globally on the Snowflake account.

Additionally, a Snowflake account can only have one network policy set globally at any given time. This resource does not enforce one-policy-per-account, it is the user's responsibility to enforce this. If multiple network policy resources have `set_for_account: true`, the final policy set on the account will be non-deterministic.

users.description: Specifies which users the network policy should be attached to

aws_sqs_arn.description: AWS SQS queue ARN for notification integration to connect to

aws_sqs_external_id.description: The external ID that Snowflake will use when assuming the AWS role

aws_sqs_iam_user_arn.description: The Snowflake user that will attempt to assume the AWS role.

aws_sqs_role_arn.description: AWS IAM role ARN for notification integration to assume

azure_storage_queue_primary_uri.description: The queue ID for the Azure Queue Storage queue created for Event Grid notifications

azure_tenant_id.description: The ID of the Azure Active Directory tenant used for identity management

created_on.description: Date and time when the notification integration was created.

direction.description: Direction of the cloud messaging with respect to Snowflake (required only for error notifications)

gcp_pubsub_subscription_name.description: The subscription id that Snowflake will listen to when using the GCP_PUBSUB provider.

notification_provider.description: The third-party cloud message queuing service (e.g. AZURE_STORAGE_QUEUE, AWS_SQS)

auto_ingest.description: Specifies a auto_ingest param for the pipe.

aws_sns_topic_arn.description: Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the SNS topic for your S3 bucket.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the pipe.

copy_statement.description: Specifies the copy statement for the pipe.

database.description: The database in which to create the pipe.

error_integration.description: Specifies the name of the notification integration used for error notifications.

integration.description: Specifies an integration for the pipe.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the pipe; must be unique for the database and schema in which the pipe is created.

notification_channel.description: Amazon Resource Name of the Amazon SQS queue for the stage named in the DEFINITION column.

owner.description: Name of the role that owns the pipe.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the pipe.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future pipes on which to grant privileges.

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future pipes in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future pipes in the given database. The pipe_name field must be unset in order to use on_future.

pipe_name.description: The name of the pipe on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is false).

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future pipe.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future pipes on which to grant privileges.

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the procedure.

database.description: The database in which to create the procedure. Don't use the | character.

execute_as.description: Sets execute context - see caller's rights and owner's rights

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the procedure; does not have to be unique for the schema in which the procedure is created. Don't use the | character.

null_input_behavior.description: Specifies the behavior of the procedure when called with null inputs.

return_behavior.description: Specifies the behavior of the function when returning results

return_type.description: The return type of the procedure

schema.description: The schema in which to create the procedure. Don't use the | character.

statement.description: Specifies the javascript code used to create the procedure.

name.description: The argument name

block.description: List of the arguments for the procedure

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future procedures on which to grant privileges.

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future procedures in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future procedures in the given database. The procedure_name and shares fields must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future procedure.

procedure_name.description: The name of the procedure on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is false).

return_type.description: The return type of the procedure (must be present if procedure_name is present)

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future procedures on which to grant privileges.

shares.description: Grants privilege to these shares (only valid if on_future is false).

name.description: The argument name

block.description: List of the arguments for the procedure (must be present if procedure has arguments and procedure_name is present)

credit_quota.description: The number of credits allocated monthly to the resource monitor.

end_timestamp.description: The date and time when the resource monitor suspends the assigned warehouses.

frequency.description: The frequency interval at which the credit usage resets to 0. If you set a frequency for a resource monitor, you must also set START_TIMESTAMP.

name.description: Identifier for the resource monitor; must be unique for your account.

notify_triggers.description: A list of percentage thresholds at which to send an alert to subscribed users.

start_timestamp.description: The date and time when the resource monitor starts monitoring credit usage for the assigned warehouses.

suspend_immediate_triggers.description: A list of percentage thresholds at which to immediately suspend all warehouses.

suspend_triggers.description: A list of percentage thresholds at which to suspend all warehouses.

monitor_name.description: Identifier for the resource monitor; must be unique for your account.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the resource monitor.

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

role_name.description: The name of the role we are granting.

roles.description: Grants role to this specified role.

users.description: Grants role to this specified user.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the row access policy.

database.description: The database in which to create the row access policy.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the row access policy; must be unique for the database and schema in which the row access policy is created.

row_access_expression.description: Specifies the SQL expression. The expression can be any boolean-valued SQL expression.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the row access policy.

signature.description: Specifies signature (arguments) for the row access policy (uppercase and sorted to avoid recreation of resource). A signature specifies a set of attributes that must be considered to determine whether the row is accessible. The attribute values come from the database object (e.g. table or view) to be protected by the row access policy.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the row access policy on which to grant privileges.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the row access policy.

row_access_policy_name.description: The name of the row access policy on which to grant privileges immediately.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the row access policy on which to grant privileges.

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the schema.

data_retention_days.description: Specifies the number of days for which Time Travel actions (CLONE and UNDROP) can be performed on the schema, as well as specifying the default Time Travel retention time for all tables created in the schema.

database.description: The database in which to create the schema.

is_managed.description: Specifies a managed schema. Managed access schemas centralize privilege management with the schema owner.

is_transient.description: Specifies a schema as transient. Transient schemas do not have a Fail-safe period so they do not incur additional storage costs once they leave Time Travel; however, this means they are also not protected by Fail-safe in the event of a data loss.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the schema; must be unique for the database in which the schema is created.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the schema on which to grant privileges.

on_future.description: When this is set to true, apply this grant on all future schemas in the given database. The schema_name and shares fields must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future schema. Note that if "OWNERSHIP" is specified, ensure that the role that terraform is using is granted access.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema on which to grant privileges.

shares.description: Grants privilege to these shares (only valid if on_future is unset).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

created_on.description: Date and time when the SCIM integration was created.

name.description: Specifies the name of the SCIM integration. This name follows the rules for Object Identifiers. The name should be unique among security integrations in your account.

network_policy.description: Specifies an existing network policy active for your account. The network policy restricts the list of user IP addresses when exchanging an authorization code for an access or refresh token and when using a refresh token to obtain a new access token. If this parameter is not set, the network policy for the account (if any) is used instead.

provisioner_role.description: Specify the SCIM role in Snowflake that owns any users and roles that are imported from the identity provider into Snowflake using SCIM.

scim_client.description: Specifies the client type for the scim integration

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the sequence.

database.description: The database in which to create the sequence. Don't use the | character.

fully_qualified_name.description: The fully qualified name of the sequence.

increment.description: The amount the sequence will increase by each time it is used

name.description: Specifies the name for the sequence.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the sequence. Don't use the | character.

When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future sequences in the given database. The sequence_name field must be unset in order to use on_future.

sequence_name.description: The name of the sequence on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is false).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

accounts.description: A list of accounts to be added to the share.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the managed account.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the share; must be unique for the account in which the share is created.

encryption.description: Specifies the encryption settings for the stage.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the stage; must be unique for the database and schema in which the stage is created.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the stage.

storage_integration.description: Specifies the name of the storage integration used to delegate authentication responsibility for external cloud storage to a Snowflake identity and access management (IAM) entity.

url.description: Specifies the URL for the stage.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current stage on which to grant privileges.

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future stages in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future stages in the given database. The stage_name and shares fields must be unset in order to use on_future.

shares.description: Grants privilege to these shares (only valid if on_future is false).

stage_name.description: The name of the stage on which to grant privilege (only valid if on_future is false).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

azure_consent_url.description: The consent URL that is used to create an Azure Snowflake service principle inside your tenant.

azure_multi_tenant_app_name.description: This is the name of the Snowflake client application created for your account.

created_on.description: Date and time when the storage integration was created.

storage_allowed_locations.description: Explicitly limits external stages that use the integration to reference one or more storage locations.

storage_aws_external_id.description: The external ID that Snowflake will use when assuming the AWS role.

storage_aws_iam_user_arn.description: The Snowflake user that will attempt to assume the AWS role.

storage_blocked_locations.description: Explicitly prohibits external stages that use the integration from referencing one or more storage locations.

storage_gcp_service_account.description: This is the name of the Snowflake Google Service Account created for your account.

append_only.description: Type of the stream that will be created.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the stream.

database.description: The database in which to create the stream.

insert_only.description: Create an insert only stream type.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the stream; must be unique for the database and schema in which the stream is created.

on_table.description: Name of the table the stream will monitor.

owner.description: Name of the role that owns the stream.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the stream.

show_initial_rows.description: Specifies whether to return all existing rows in the source table as row inserts the first time the stream is consumed.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future streams on which to grant privileges.

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future streams in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future streams in the given database. The stream_name field must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future stream.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future streams on which to grant privileges.

stream_name.description: The name of the stream on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is false).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

change_tracking.description: Specifies whether to enable change tracking on the table. Default false.

cluster_by.description: A list of one or more table columns/expressions to be used as clustering key(s) for the table

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the table.

data_retention_days.description: Specifies the retention period for the table so that Time Travel actions (SELECT, CLONE, UNDROP) can be performed on historical data in the table. Default value is 1, if you wish to inherit the parent schema setting then pass in the schema attribute to this argument.

database.description: The database in which to create the table.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the table; must be unique for the database and schema in which the table is created.

owner.description: Name of the role that owns the table.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the table.

comment.description: Column comment

name.description: Column name

nullable.description: Whether this column can contain null values. **Note**: Depending on your Snowflake version, the default value will not suffice if this column is used in a primary key constraint.

constant.description: The default constant value for the column

expression.description: The default expression value for the column

sequence.description: The default sequence to use for the column

block.description: Defines the column default value; note due to limitations of Snowflake's ALTER TABLE ADD/MODIFY COLUMN updates to default will not be applied
Definitions of a column to create in the table. Minimum one required.

keys.description: Columns to use in primary key

name.description: Name of constraint

block.description: Definitions of primary key constraint to create on table

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future tables on which to grant privileges.

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future tables in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future tables in the given database. The table_name and shares fields must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future table.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future tables on which to grant privileges.

shares.description: Grants privilege to these shares (only valid if on_future is unset).

table_name.description: The name of the table on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is unset).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

after.description: Specifies the predecessor task in the same database and schema of the current task. When a run of the predecessor task finishes successfully, it triggers this task (after a brief lag).

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the task.

database.description: The database in which to create the task.

enabled.description: Specifies if the task should be started (enabled) after creation or should remain suspended (default).

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the task; must be unique for the database and schema in which the task is created.

schedule.description: The schedule for periodically running the task. This can be a cron or interval in minutes.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the task.

session_parameters.description: Specifies session parameters to set for the session when the task runs. A task supports all session parameters.

sql_statement.description: Any single SQL statement, or a call to a stored procedure, executed when the task runs.

user_task_timeout_ms.description: Specifies the time limit on a single run of the task before it times out (in milliseconds).

warehouse.description: The warehouse the task will use.

when.description: Specifies a Boolean SQL expression; multiple conditions joined with AND/OR are supported.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future tasks on which to grant privileges.

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future tasks in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future tasks in the given database. The task_name field must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future task.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future tasks on which to grant privileges.

task_name.description: The name of the task on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is false).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

default_namespace.description: Specifies the namespace (database only or database and schema) that is active by default for the user’s session upon login.

default_role.description: Specifies the role that is active by default for the user’s session upon login.

default_warehouse.description: Specifies the virtual warehouse that is active by default for the user’s session upon login.

display_name.description: Name displayed for the user in the Snowflake web interface.

has_rsa_public_key.description: Will be true if user as an RSA key set.

login_name.description: The name users use to log in. If not supplied, snowflake will use name instead.

must_change_password.description: Specifies whether the user is forced to change their password on next login (including their first/initial login) into the system.

name.description: Name of the user. Note that if you do not supply login_name this will be used as login_name. [doc](https://docs.snowflake.net/manuals/sql-reference/sql/create-user.html#required-parameters)

password.description: **WARNING:** this will put the password in the terraform state file. Use carefully.

rsa_public_key.description: Specifies the user’s RSA public key; used for key-pair authentication. Must be on 1 line without header and trailer.

rsa_public_key_2.description: Specifies the user’s second RSA public key; used to rotate the public and private keys for key-pair authentication based on an expiration schedule set by your organization. Must be on 1 line without header and trailer.

name.description: Name of the user.

rsa_public_key.description: Specifies the user’s RSA public key; used for key-pair authentication. Must be on 1 line without header and trailer.

rsa_public_key_2.description: Specifies the user’s second RSA public key; used to rotate the public and Public keys for key-pair authentication based on an expiration schedule set by your organization. Must be on 1 line without header and trailer.

comment.description: Specifies a comment for the view.

database.description: The database in which to create the view. Don't use the | character.

is_secure.description: Specifies that the view is secure.

name.description: Specifies the identifier for the view; must be unique for the schema in which the view is created. Don't use the | character.

or_replace.description: Overwrites the View if it exists.

schema.description: The schema in which to create the view. Don't use the | character.

statement.description: Specifies the query used to create the view.

database_name.description: The name of the database containing the current or future views on which to grant privileges.

on_future.description: When this is set to true and a schema_name is provided, apply this grant on all future views in the given schema. When this is true and no schema_name is provided apply this grant on all future views in the given database. The view_name and shares fields must be unset in order to use on_future.

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the current or future view.

schema_name.description: The name of the schema containing the current or future views on which to grant privileges.

shares.description: Grants privilege to these shares (only valid if on_future is unset).

view_name.description: The name of the view on which to grant privileges immediately (only valid if on_future is unset).

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

auto_resume.description: Specifies whether to automatically resume a warehouse when a SQL statement (e.g. query) is submitted to it.

auto_suspend.description: Specifies the number of seconds of inactivity after which a warehouse is automatically suspended.

initially_suspended.description: Specifies whether the warehouse is created initially in the ‘Suspended’ state.

max_cluster_count.description: Specifies the maximum number of server clusters for the warehouse.

max_concurrency_level.description: Object parameter that specifies the concurrency level for SQL statements (i.e. queries and DML) executed by a warehouse.

min_cluster_count.description: Specifies the minimum number of server clusters for the warehouse (only applies to multi-cluster warehouses).

name.description: Identifier for the virtual warehouse; must be unique for your account.

resource_monitor.description: Specifies the name of a resource monitor that is explicitly assigned to the warehouse.

scaling_policy.description: Specifies the policy for automatically starting and shutting down clusters in a multi-cluster warehouse running in Auto-scale mode.

statement_queued_timeout_in_seconds.description: Object parameter that specifies the time, in seconds, a SQL statement (query, DDL, DML, etc.) can be queued on a warehouse before it is canceled by the system.

statement_timeout_in_seconds.description: Specifies the time, in seconds, after which a running SQL statement (query, DDL, DML, etc.) is canceled by the system

wait_for_provisioning.description: Specifies whether the warehouse, after being resized, waits for all the servers to provision before executing any queued or new queries.

warehouse_size.description: Specifies the size of the virtual warehouse. Larger warehouse sizes 5X-Large and 6X-Large are currently in preview and only available on Amazon Web Services (AWS).

privilege.description: The privilege to grant on the warehouse.

warehouse_name.description: The name of the warehouse on which to grant privileges.

with_grant_option.description: When this is set to true, allows the recipient role to grant the privileges to other roles.

account.description: The Snowflake Account ID; as returned by CURRENT_ACCOUNT().

region.description: The Snowflake Region; as returned by CURRENT_REGION()

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

external_functions.description: The external functions in the schema

schema.description: The schema from which to return the external functions from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

external_tables.description: The external tables in the schema

schema.description: The schema from which to return the external tables from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

file_formats.description: The file formats in the schema

schema.description: The schema from which to return the file formats from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the functions from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the maskingPolicies from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the views from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the pipes from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the procedures from.

resource_monitors.description: The resource monitors in the database

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

row_access_policies.description: The row access policy in the schema

schema.description: The schema from which to return the row access policyfrom.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.
The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the sequences from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the stages from.

storage_integrations.description: The storage integrations in the database

database.description: The database from which to return the streams from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the streams from.

aws_sns_topic_arn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic for your S3 bucket

aws_sns_topic_policy_json.description: IAM policy for Snowflake’s SQS queue to subscribe to this topic

account_name.description: The name of your Snowflake account.

account_url.description: The URL used to connect to Snowflake through AWS PrivateLink or Azure Private Link.

aws_vpce_id.description: The AWS VPCE ID for your account.

azure_pls_id.description: The Azure Private Link Service ID for your account.

oscp_url.description: The OCSP URL corresponding to your Snowflake account that uses AWS PrivateLink or Azure Private Link.

aws_vpc_ids.description: Snowflake AWS Virtual Private Cloud IDs

azure_vnet_subnet_ids.description: Snowflake Azure Virtual Network Subnet IDs

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the tables from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the tasks from.

database.description: The database from which to return the schemas from.

schema.description: The schema from which to return the views from.
